title: Suspicious DNS
description:
Analyze these DNS queries captured from a workstation. One of them is suspicious:

Query: www.google.com → 142.250.80.46 (A record)
Query: mail.company.com → 10.0.0.25 (A record)
Query: aGFja2VkLmV2aWwuY29t.dns-tunnel.attacker.net → 10.10.14.5 (A record)
Query: outlook.office365.com → 52.96.88.34 (A record)
Query: update.windows.com → 13.107.4.52 (A record)

The suspicious query uses a technique to exfiltrate data. What encoding is used in the subdomain?

Submit as: flag{encoding_type}
hints: One DNS query has an unusual-looking subdomain
The subdomain 'aGFja2VkLmV2aWwuY29t' looks encoded, not like a real hostname
Decode it from base64: aGFja2VkLmV2aWwuY29t = 'hacked.evil.com' — this is DNS tunneling
